Detailed Description

MotorController - interface class to the RoboteQ 2440 motor controller

References serialPortSem.

MotorController::MotorController ( ) [private]

MotorController constructor

Parameters:
portName- the serial port over which the commands will be sent
enableEcho- set to true to check error for errors from the motor controller
motor1Max- the maximum power for channel1 defined on the interval [1000,-1000] where -1000 is full reverse
motor2Max- the maximum power for channel2 defined on the interval [1000, -1000] where -1000 is full reverse
motor1Min- the minimum power for channel1
motor2Min- the minimum power for channel2

Definition at line 95 of file MotorController.cpp.

bool MotorController::setCommandLinearity ( int  linearity)

SetCommandLinearity - This parameter is used for applying an exponential or a logarithmic transformation on the command input, regardless of its source (serial, pulse or analog). There are 3 exponential and 3 logarithmic choices. Exponential correction make the commands change less at the beginning and become stronger at the end of the command input range. The logarithmic correction will have a stronger effect near the start and lesser effect near the end. The linear selection causes no change to the input. A linearity transform is also available for all analog and pulse inputs. Both can be enabled although in most cases, it is best to use the Command Linearity parameter for modifying command profiles. 0 : linear (no change) 1 : exp weak 2 : exp medium 3 : exp strong 4 : log weak 5 : log medium 6 : log strong

Definition at line 290 of file MotorController.cpp.

bool MotorController::setCommandPriority ( int  signal,
int  priority 
)

setCommandPriority - This parameter contains up to 3 variables and is used to set which type of command in priority the controller will respond to and in which order. The first item is the first priority, second – second priority, third – third priority. Each priority item is then one of the three command modes: Serial, Analog or RC Pulse. 1 : Serial 2 : RC 3 : Analog

Parameters:
signal- the singal to set to the priority
priority- the priority level to be set for the signal
Returns:
true upon success

bool MotorController::setOverVoltageLimit ( double  limit)

setOverVoltageLimit - sets the maximum voltage value for the power stage. Higher voltages will cause the motor controller to turn off and signal an overvoltage fault

Parameters:
limit- the upper limit of the power stage voltage measured in volts
Returns:
true upon success

Definition at line 300 of file MotorController.cpp.

bool MotorController::setShortCircuitDetectionThreshold ( int  value)

setShortCircuitDetectionThreshold - Short Circuit Detection Threshold This configuration parameter sets the threshold level for the short circuit detection. There are 4 sensitivity levels from 0 to 3. 0 : Very high sensitivity 1 : Medium sensitivity 2 : Low sensitivity 3 : Short circuit protection disabled Using a value of 3 will cause an error

Parameters:
value- the sensitivity of the short circuit detection threshold to be used
Returns:
true upon success
